What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List: I developed a general knowledge of Stem Cells and their various locations and functions.
I learned a great deal of stem cell biology and how iPSCs can be used in research and the clinic.
I learned more about many kinds of stem cells and how to synthesize that information.

Great introduction to stem cell biology and application. We also cover genetic techniques used in the study of SCs. You get to read some great primary material on what is currently going on in the field.
Comprehensive introduction to stem cells and their clinical application

The major strength is the expertise of the lecturers, bringing their knowledge and perspective to the different fields. The weakness was in the administrative support, with little to no feedback on work, or way to judge the status of standing in the class.

Though the class is interesting and I like how experts come in to talk about their fields, we never receive any feedback. Even I asked for feedback, I wasn't given feedback because half of my grade was the final. Feedback beyond grades is necessary for learning and even if half of my grade is the final, giving students updates on their performance in the class through grades is important so students know what we are doing well and what we need to improve.

The strengths were that the course is well structured and has many impressive and esteemed faculty lecturers. 

The weaknesses of the course were primarily that is was such a long course, and due to the last two lecturers being extremely dull, it was difficult to focus. To improve the course, remove Dr. Rizzolo and Dr. Fan as these lectures were not really focused on stem cell biology or application and were incredibly boring.

The strengths of the course revolves around the expertise of each of the instructors. Utilizing a different instructor teaching their own speciality makes this class unique and enjoyable. 

One of the problems in the course was a lack of feedback through the course. We did not receive any graded assessments which makes it impossible to know how we are doing in the course and if we are doing the right work.
It felt like just the right amount of everything for this type of course.

Strengths: excellent lecturers, class format (1/2 lecture, 1/2 journal club) allowed for solid introductions to the material and engagement with the literature
Weaknesses: some lectures felt repetitive (e.g. hematopoietic system), little to no opportunities for feedback
Definitely! This was a great way to get acquainted with the field.
Yes, this class (or at least select lectures) was very enlightening for students interested in stem cell biology and applications.
Yes. I enjoyed the class and learned more about stem cells which I wish to study in my career. I also liked meeting other grad students who have similar interest in the small class
This course has broad applicability. I would recommend it to any student who either works with stem cells directly or whose work overlaps with cell lineage, development, etc.
